gw.api.email

Class AbstractEmailMessageTransport

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.email.AbstractEmailMessageTransport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, InitializablePlugin, MessagePlugin, MessageTransport, java.rmi.Remote

    public abstract class AbstractEmailMessageTransport
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageTransport, InitializablePlugin
    Super class of email plugin class. This provides basic email sending capabilities and still provde the hook for the sub class to override the exception handling behaviors.

    • Method Detail

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: MessagePlugin
        Messaging shut down occurs during server shutdown or if the configuration is about to be re-read. When message sending is resumed again, the same instance of the plugin will reused. The existing messaging plugin instance is *not* destroyed and re-created as part of shutdown.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface MessagePlugin

      • suspend

        public void suspend()
        Description copied from interface: MessagePlugin
        Called when message sending is about to be suspended. This occurs when the user explicitly suspends a destination AND when an error occurs during MessagePlugin.resume()
        Specified by:
        suspend in interface MessagePlugin

      • resume

        public void resume()
            throws InitializationException
        Description copied from interface: MessagePlugin
        Called when message sending is about to be resumed AND also when a destination is started in non-suspended state. A call to resume() is guaranteed to precede any message handling calls to the plugin (e.g. MessageTransport.send()). The plugin should do any setup required before handling messages. If an InitializationException is thrown from the method, the destination will be suspended (or left suspended, if previously suspended). Any other exception will cause the call to fail and the exception to propagate back to the caller. If this happens during server startup, the startup will fail. This means that an anticipated failure (such as a failure to connect to a message queue) should be caught and rethrown as an InitializationException.
        Specified by:
        resume in interface MessagePlugin
        Throws:
        InitializationException

      • setDestinationID

        public void setDestinationID(int destinationID)
        Description copied from interface: MessagePlugin
        Called when the plugin is instantiated (before MessagePlugin.resume()) to supply the destination ID. Since a given plugin class may be used by multiple destinations, this allows each instance to know what destination it is associated with. Implementors of this interface will typically store the destinationID in a member variable of the implementing class for later use in logging, etc.
        Specified by:
        setDestinationID in interface MessagePlugin
        Parameters:
        destinationID - An int identifying the destination (from destination configuration specified in config.xml).

      • setParameters

        public void setParameters(java.util.Map params)
        Sets the parameter for the email transport
        • smtpHost: the host name of the mail server
        • smtpPort: the port of the mail server
        • defaultSenderName: the default sender email address
        • defaultSenderName: the default sender name
        Specified by:
        setParameters in interface InitializablePlugin
        Parameters:
        params - parameter map from plugin configuration

      • send

        public void send(Message message,
                 java.lang.String transformedPayload)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: MessageTransport
        Send the message. The plugin may optionally ack the message and update any fields; changes to the message and any other modified beans will be persisted after the send method completes (and after the MessageRequest plugin has completed work in its afterSend() method). The transformedPayload parameter is set to the String returned from the Request plugin's beforeSend() method. By default, if no Request plugin is defined for the destination, the transformedPayload is set to be equal to the original Message payload. If the beforeSend() in the MessageRequest plugin changes the message status, the send() method will not be called.

        Exceptions will cause the send operation (including another call to Request.beforeSend()) to be retried until retries are exhausted.

        Specified by:
        send in interface MessageTransport
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • handleInvalidAddresses

        protected boolean handleInvalidAddresses(Email email,
                                         javax.mail.Address[] invalidAddresses)
        Handles the invalid addresses in the email. If this method returns true, it is assumed that the addresses have been fixed and the email will be resent. Note that if not implemented correctly this could cause dead loop.
        Parameters:
        email - Email to send
        invalidAddresses - the invalid addresses
        Returns:
        true if you mant the email to be sent again.

      • sendEmail

        protected void sendEmail(java.lang.String smtpHost,
                         java.lang.String smtpPort,
                         Message message,
                         Email email)
        The method that sends the email and handles the exception. This method sholud mark the message approriately to the right state
        Parameters:
        smtpHost - SMTP host name
        smtpPort - SMTP port number
        message - message in which the email is contained.
        email - email information

      • createHtmlEmailAndSend

        protected void createHtmlEmailAndSend(java.lang.String smtpHost,
                                      java.lang.String smtpPort,
                                      Email email)
                               throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Template method to handle sending the email. This method does not need to do exception handling
        Parameters:
        smtpHost - SMTP host name
        smtpPort - SMTP host port number
        email - email object
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - Any exception occurred during the operation

      • getFileExtensionForDocument

        protected java.lang.String getFileExtensionForDocument(Document docBase)
        This will return the file extension for the mime type of the doucment if any. Note that the configuration of mime types has a string, extension, that should have the leading zero. It is not checked here.
        Parameters:
        docBase - the document to extract the mime type from
        Returns:
        either the extension or an empty string.

                                               java.lang.Throwable exception)
        Handles the general exception occurred when sending the email
        Parameters:
        message - the message entity
        email - the email to send
        exception - the exception occurred

      • handleMessageException

        protected abstract boolean handleMessageException(Message message,
                                                  Email email,
                                                  javax.mail.MessagingException messageException)
        Handles the more specific message exception occurred when sending the email
        Parameters:
        message - Message entity
        email - email to send
        messageException - exception occurred
        Returns:
        true if the handling code has fixed the email and would like to resend it

      • setSenderReplyTo

        public static void setSenderReplyTo(Email email,
                                    com.guidewire.pl.system.email.HtmlEmail htmlEmail,
                                    java.lang.String defaultSenderEmail,
                                    java.lang.String defaultSenderName)
                             throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Set the sender and reply to fields. They are set to the values in emailFields. If the sender in emailFields is null, then the from is set to the defaults. If the replyto in emailFields is null, then the replyto is set to the sender or to the defaults if sender is null.
        Parameters:
        email - contains sender and replyto information.
        htmlEmail - the email object
        defaultSenderEmail - the default sender email
        defaultSenderName - the default sender name
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - exception
